revised_title: Nonlinear Break-up Criterion and Experimental Comparisons in Channel Flow
tldr: The authors study the transition of plane Poiseuille flow in a wind channel, focusing on the weakly and strongly nonlinear stages. They compare their theoretical findings with experiments by Nishioka et al. (1979) and find encouraging quantitative agreement. The study highlights the importance of nonlinear disturbances in understanding the transition process and the potential of the nonlinear break-up criterion for predicting breakup transition.
